question: 地下街
sourceMnemonic: An <kanji>underground</kanji> (<ja>地下</ja>) <kanji>street</kanji> isn't as underground streety as it sounds. A lot of the underground streets and areas in Japan tend to be <vocabulary>underground shopping mall</vocabulary>s, though. That or subways/trains, but <vocabulary>underground shopping center</vocabulary>s are way more interesting.
sourceReadingMnemonic: This is a jukugo word, which usually means on'yomi readings from the kanji. If you know the readings of your kanji you'll know how to read this as well.
